Reviews.Title: “Really Good Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: PT2_212
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Wildner for 3 nights in March 2012 and were impressed by the level of service and value for money. We opted to pay a little less and stay in a room without the canal view however, given the location, the water view rooms would be great too. The hotel is within 5 mins walk to Piazza San Marco and around 10mins from Rialto bridge. Access from the train station is easy on the Vaperetto with a stop virtually at the front door. Breakfast was included which was more than adequate and there are ample restaurants very close by. The decor of the hotel is typical of most mid range Venice hotels, so not exactly modern but very clean and well maintained. Would definately recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LizMelbourne
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 2 nights. We were travelling with our 11 year old daughter.This hotel was perfect. It was 2 minute walk to piazza di san marco. It had the water bus stop immediately out the front of the hotel which made it perfect for an arrival from the train station and also for the water bus to the airport - not one bridge or step to carry your suitcase over! We had a room with a view of the canal and it was beautiful. Staff were very helpful. breakfast was a plentiful continental breakfast. the price was very reasonable (for venice) and i would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel, especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: sverkhovsky
Reviews.Content: Great location - right in front of alilaguna and vaporetto stops and a short walk to San Marco and the Realto. Great view of San Giorgio, with some amazing sunsets on the clear days. The front desk staff are nice and helpful. Free wifi Internet (although the password system is a pain). Nice restaurant at the bottom. No elevator, but the staff will bring your bags up and down. Super loud wood floor. The bed is big, but the mattress is wafer thin and it's two singles put together. All in all I would come back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Amazing cooperation from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: adtombeck
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for the 12th of February for 3 nights but due to the snowstorm in Rome our flights were delayed and thus missed our flight to Venice. I informed the hotel that we could not arrive (as flights the next day were full) and asked them to hold our prepayment for our next trip to Venice. Although when I booked the conditions clearly stipulated that no refunds were due in case of not turning up, the management of the hotel kindly kept our money on account for our next trip to Venice. This is amazing cooperation from this hotel bearing in mind that I stay in hotels minimum 3 months every year. It is so nice when hotels understand us visitors. I look forward to my next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, charming, great breakfast, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: plan09
Reviews.Content: Sadly we only had one night in Venice so wanted to be close to San Marco and not have to go too far with our suitcases. The hotel is literally in front of the #2 vaporetta stop San Zaccaria and a few minutes from the #1 stop. We arrived prior to check in and were able to leave our suitcases, allowing us to head out for sight seeing. I had requested a room on a lower floor, knowing there was no elevator, and room 18 was perfect for us, just at the top of the staircase on the 1st floor. The room was very nice and the bathroom clean, spacious and modern. The restaurant was closed so we didn't get to eat there but did enjoy the very complete breakfast looking over the canal in the morning. Elvio and the staff were very helpful and friendly, it couldn't have been a better trip to Venice. We had a great stay and enjoyed the hotel and walking around the area, minutes from San Marco. Send me a PM if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “hotel wildner/ apartment”
Reviews.Author: baino
Reviews.Content: hi we have just returned from venice went 12/01 to 15/01/12 we booked the hotel wildner but got a email to say hotel would be closed due to work being done and would we mind taking a apartment which was just the back of the hotel a 2 minute walk it was a 2bed 2bath over 2 floors and there was just me and my wife the bed was huge bigger than my own king size bed and was very cosy . as others have said the hotel is in a perfect location and i would return here again loved it

Reviews.Title: “Short break away to Venice....”
Reviews.Author: SidAmy I
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend had decided to visit venice during decmeber we thought the weather would have been cold but turned out to be quite warm, arriving at the airport and collecting baggage was pretty straight forward. We decided to take a water bus (alilaguna-blue line. one way price was 15euros p.p) and got off at the stop named s.zacaria and the hotel was directly infront of the stop. The hotel itself was located in a brilliant place right in the midst of san marco square. The hotel staff were nice and helpful, but the 1st mission was getting up the, what felt, never ending stairs. we were located right at the 4th floor with a lagoon view. now, the lagoon view was paid extra, but frankly, we could of got the same view through normal windows. the bed was cosy but the room itself was a little cramped. the 2nd mission was to find a reasonable place to eat, after reading about the high prices of dining in venice. the 1st night, we ate at the hotel, and i have never been appalled with how little food we received at such a high price, and it wasn't exactly fancy (four pieces of ravioli cost 15euros, 330ml of water was 6euros). i would recommend to go to a supermarket, or a small grocery shop to buy small bits like water and drinks etc. The views were brilliant and would highly recommend a gondola tour (80 euros). Whilst our time there, we managed to find a little restaurant named Antica Sacrestia venizia which did 3 course meals for 20euros. regarding shopping, everything is pricey, but at the markets, you may have a chance to haggle. the further away from san marco, the cheaper everything is. on the last day, we took a water taxi back to the airport which took around 25mins and cost 100euros. All in all, was a great experience, but i personally think i will not be returning just because of the dear prices and just for the experience we had. I hope this review has given you an idea of how the holiday and prices were. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: mickey65
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the 7th & 8th, you could not get a better location. A two minute walk to St. Marks, water bus and gondala outside the door, View of St Giorgio and Salute from your window. The room was quite large for Italy, and reasonably appointed. The single Bed is only suitable for a child under 8 my 12 year old was too long and too wide for it. Our bed was lumpy and not very comfortable. The bathroom appears to have been newly renovated but they need to look at their maintenance, the toilet seat was broken, toilet door didnt shut, room door didnt lock properly from the inside, shutters would not shut properly. But the worst thing was the heat it was too hot to sleep in the room and no way to cool it down, the reatirant for breakfast you needed shorts & tshirt even though it was 1 degree outside. Breakfast was nice pastries and cereal, cuppacino provided. We couldnt try the fabled restaurant as it closed when we arrived together with nearly every other restaurant near St marks square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, great room, great restaurant, friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel within a few yards of the vaporetto berth San Vaccaria was ideal. Our two meals in the restaurant were among the best we had during our 8 day stay and the breakfasts (included) were very good and varied. The staff couldn't have been more helpful in advising us on outings and getting tickets for concerts. Our room facing the Grand Canal was comfortable with a terrific view at a reasonable price for the location. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location!!”
Reviews.Author: UkReggie75
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in Venice - excellent location. Clean, comfortable rooms with lovely views of Venice. Easy to find, which is not always the case in Venice!! Close to great bars and restaurants. Breakfast room fantastic view - food pretty standard for Italian breakfasts in our experience, although fresh fruit salad was a bonus on Sat morning. We would definitely stay again at the right price!!

Reviews.Title: “Exellent small hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: chayo_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last october. This small hotel has a great location, just two blocks from Piazza San Marcos. The reception and entrance are really small. Our rooms were on the first floor with a GREAT VIEW to San Giorgio Maggiore!! Although transportation with baggage in Venice is difficult, it is easy to arrive to the hotel by vaporetto (stop Zacaria). Good price taking in consideration that Venice is really expensive. Very good breakfast. Nice staff. We will certainly return!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: boboakville
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel based on a previous visit to Venice and reviews on TripAdvisor. The location is what makes this hotel. We took the Alilaguna Blue Line water bus from Marco Polo airport and it dropped us off almost in front of the hotel. It's a good basic hotel at a reasonable rate for Venice Lagoon properties. The rooms were clean and quiet, at least on the top floor. Our KLM flight was 6 hours late, so we got the last two rooms on the top floor. Be aware, there is no elevator. The check-in staff did offer to assist carrying our bags up four floors. You can't beat eating your continental breakfast sitting on the promenade overlooking Venice Lagoon. Many passers-by eyed our spot jealously each morning of the 3 days we stayed at the hotel. It's a 5 minute walk to St Mark's Square, and of course, it's easy walking distance to lots of restaurants and cafes. We'd certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A lucky find!”
Reviews.Author: Keli528
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful 3 night stay at the Hotel Wildner on a two-week trip to Italy in September. We had a charming room with view overlooking the Grand Canal which was pricier than their standard rooms but worth the extra cost. Could not ask for a better location being right on the Canal and close to St Marks Square. Breakfast was great...one of the best we had in Italy. Sorry we did not have dinner there looking at other reviews. The guys at the front desk were all wonderful! Very friendly and very helpful. We especially enjoyed Elvo(sp?) with his sense of humour and helpfullness. I would definitely stay here again and recommend it to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Convienent, Charming, Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Debra C
Reviews.Content: I am rewriting this review, because the previous one mentioned that the hotel Wildner was right in front of the Zattere stop. It is in front of the Zaccaria stop. Sorry if I misled anyone. We chose this hotel because of the great reviews and location. Thanks to all that take the time to write so that the rest of us can learn from your experiences. And now I can return the favor by telling you how much we enjoyed our stay in Venice and at the Wildner. Before coming here, I researched the best hotels and enotecas that offered cheap prices. I printed out maps and directions from the vaporetti stops. I bought two 48 hour vaporetti tickets online for 27 euros each ( A 60 minute one way ride is 6,50 euro). The vaporetti are a must for getting around in Venice. Walking is fine and is the only way to see the wonders of the back streets and small canals, but the vaporetti can take you anywhere in Venice far or near with a million dollar view. A pass can pay for itself in just a few hours of site-seeing. We were there for two days prior to a Mediterranean cruise and must have rode the vaporetti from here and there a couple of dozen times. The Zaccaria stop is right in front of the hotel Wildner. The Alilaguna also stops there. The Alilaguna is the best way to get to the hotel or straight to the cruise terminal from the airport or vice versa (the vaporetti do not go to the airport). I bought one way Alilaguna tickets on line as well before we left so we could go directly from the baggage claim, get a baggage cart and go for a reasonably short walk to the Alilaguna station. We boarded the boat with all our luggage and just sat back and enjoyed the beautiful view as we saw Venice for the first time. It seemed like a short trip, but I had read that it takes more than and hour to get to our stop (we didn't keep track of the time, the boat ride was so much fun). When we got off, we saw our hotel and just rolled our luggage a short walk and checked in. The Hotel was charming. We didnâ€™t pay the extra price for a lagoon view, but our second floor room did have a window with an interesting view of an alley and some rooftops. It was typically small, but economically spaced and extremely clean and quiet. I even took a picture of the wall paper and headboard . I would not say it was dated at all as has been previously described in some reviews, but rather in good Venetian taste. A free breakfast buffet was served in the canopied restaurant at the front of the hotel. It was a perfect setting on the alluring Riva Degli Schiavori as passers by were as interesting to watch as the scenery itself. Although we didnâ€™t have dinner at the hotel restaurant, whenever we went by it was always full of people while other restaurants nearby scarcely had anyone. We chose to eat at enotecas or wine bars as it is a lot cheaper and we are light eaters. Besides which, we were going to be on a cruise for 31 days and have gourmet meals every night. The enotecas I researched turned out wonderful. We went back to a couple twice. One thing I will tell you is to read the prices on the menus. There are usually two prices for the same thing, one for if you want a table, and a cheaper one if you donâ€™t mind standing. The locals always stand and pay half as much as the tired tourist. Some of the ones we went to offered free seating, excellent food, and cheap prices thanks to the reviews I researched. If youâ€™re going to Venice for the first time, the Wildner hotel is as convenient at it gets, and lives up to itâ€™s good reviews. We went in August 2011, and the weather while hot when standing in lines out of the shade, was pleasant most everywhere else. The air-conditioning in our room was just fine. In fact, we had the window open in the mornings after we got up and did not see one mosquito. Elevators in hotels do not make for a good hotel. In a lot of other places we have stayed with elevators, upon arrival they always insisted on taking our luggage to the room anyway. So it cost you a couple of euros for a tip, but itâ€™s a small price to pay for a Hotel that offers so much in other ways for such reasonable prices. If walking up and down stairs is a problem, then of course this is not the hotel for you, but then neither is Venice the city for you. We requested a room on the second floor with a window, and that is what we got (some hotels donâ€™t even have a window in all their rooms). As far as the hotel operators being aloof, that was an issue at the very bottom of my want list. The same applies to restaurants and wine bars. If you want to go where the locals go (off the beaten track) for the best food and drink choices, donâ€™t expect too much attention if you donâ€™t speak any Italian. If you do speak a little Italian it can be a wonderful experience communicating with them. They want to help you, but they need to understand you first. Thanks for reading this, and I hope you enjoy Venice as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: alwysluv2travel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is easy to get to from the train station via the vaporetto number 41 or 2 which stop outside the hotel. The location is the best thing about this hotel. St Marks is two minutes walk and you go through the alleys behind the hotel to get to other areas quicker avoiding going through St Marks Square every time. The views are amazing across the lagoon and you see the cruise ships coming in and out and there is always activity outside to look at. The reception area is tiny and staff could be a bit more welcoming as mentioned in other reviews. We booked a room for a family of four on the top floor with the lagoon view. The view is absolutely fantastic although the room was quite small. With four suitcases, 2 adults and 2 teens it was a bit squeezy and the furnishings a little tired although clean as well as the bathroom being clean and modern. The staff help with your suitcases up the narrow staircase to the top floor. This floor is best as it avoids any noise from other rooms or floors above you. The lights did go out on a few occassions but was quickly rectified. The wifi connection was not great with it dropping in and out constantly which was frustrating but found very early in the morning the connection was better. We would probably return but may book two rooms if travelling with four people or check out nearby hotels. However overall it was quite good value for money considering you only really sleep there because Venice is too amazing to stay in your room.

Reviews.Title: “Air con and a great view at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: SKALondon
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to Pensione Wildner. The location is excellent - the Allilaguna boat from the airport stops almost outside and there are no bridges to cross, its a few minutes walk from St Mark's and the view across the lagoon to San Giorgio is stunning. The decor is a little tired but the location, air conditioning, staff and reasonable (for Venice) prices more than make up for that. The breakfast offers one of the widest choices of an Italian hotel buffet style breakfast I've come across. There is juice, croissants, ham and cheese, yoghurts, fruit salad and bread. Give the filter coffee a miss and ask for a cappuccino which they make fresh and bring to your table. As is often the case with Venetian hotels there is no lift and the top floor can be quite a climb in the heat.

Reviews.Title: “We love it”
Reviews.Author: Marika B
Reviews.Content: the service is fantastic, It was easy to find and close to everything. Overall the view was the main attraction

Reviews.Title: “Magical Venice :0)”
Reviews.Author: citybreak01
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful weekend in Venice staying at the Hotel Wildner, I can only echo the words of the previous good reviews and to say we couldn't fault it at all, we stayed on the 4th floor in room 45 and had a perfect canal view from both windows, a tip would be that it was well worth paying the extra for the view, you can call me soft but when we got into our room and opened the windows I got all emotional at the beauty of the view!! No the hotel does not have a lift but the staff will take your bags up for you if you would like them too, we took our bags up to our room ourselves and did not find it a problem at all. Our room was not that big really but it was lovely and more than adequate for our needs, we had to leave the air conditioning on all night as it was incredibly hot when we were there, I have to say it was a godsend!! The location of the hotel is perfect just a few minutes from St Marks Square, we had so much fun "getting lost" on our walks up the side streets and over the many bridges! The breakfast at the hotel is self service continental with a choice of cereal's, meats & cheese, bread rolls, french bread, croissants, fresh fruit and yogurts, coffee/tea and orange juice, we had a meal at the Hotel one evening and the food was excellent but fairly expensive, bear in mind that you do get 10% off your bill if you are staying at the Hotel, as an example.. we paid 91 Euros for.. One starter to share, 2 main meals, one dessert to share, a bottle of Rose wine and a glass of brandy!! The staff were all very friendly and Nico on the reception desk was very helpful to us whenever we asked for some help....so if you are reading this...thank you Nico!! You must be aware that it is very expensive to eat and drink in Venice but if you choose the resturants that are up the side streets away from the canal you will pay less, for an example we had a bottle of beer and a diet coke sitting opposite the canal and it cost us 18 Euros but when we had the same 2 drinks up one of the side streets it was only 8 Euros, a tip would be for you to buy a couple of drinks from one of the shops or stands near the canal at a fraction of the price and then find yourself a spot to sit either by the canal or in St Marks Square....perfect :0) Another tip would be...DO NOT forget to take your camera as there are photo opportunites everywhere you turn, we took literally hundres of photo's! We fell head over heals in love with Venice and would love to return sometime in the future, we would have no hesitation in staying at The hotel Wildner again and would recommend it to family and friends without a moments hesitation...ENJOY :0)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great deal!”
Reviews.Author: Sara F
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in July 2011 in a triple-room with a canal view. The hotel itself was average/standard but the location was AMAZING. The room and bathroom were small, but they were both very clean and since we didn't spend much time in the room, the size was fine. There is no elevator/lift, but when we checked in, they carried our bags to our room (3rd floor) and when we checked out, they brought them back down. They had a receptionist at the front desk 24-hours a day, but most of the staff weren't very helpful or informative. The breakfast was average: croissants, cereal, rolls, coffee, juice, sliced meat/cheese. The hotel is located right on the canal, a 3 minute walk to St. Mark's with multiple vaparetto stops going different places right near by. We would stay here again, mostly due to the fabulous location.

Reviews.Title: “Wery nice!”
Reviews.Author: Danut_Bersan
Reviews.Content: Excellent location, on the pier at San Marco Square near bus-boat station. Great food. Excellent value for money. Ana & Dan

Reviews.Title: “We WON'T be back”
Reviews.Author: Vera_always
Reviews.Content: This was the worse hotel we stayed at during our trip in Italy. Definitely not a 3-star hotel. The first night, our lights went out three times, and the a/c was not working well. The front desk staff were aloof. The last morning, my husband woke up with bites that we think it may have been mosquito bites. I frantically looked to make sure there were no bed bugs and I can say I didn't see anything on the mattress. We did not stay in a room with a view, but for the price we paid it was not worth it at all. The only positive things I can report is that some of the restaurant staff are friendly and so is the cleaning staff. The bathrooms were clean and the room though it looked old and dreary, was clean. The location is good but I don't think you can get a bad location in Venice. Please do yourself a favor and avoid this hotel. I read the positive comments before booking and I feel that I got a bum deal. Especially when we were looking forward to visiting Venice and celebrate our 24th wedding anniversary. We avoided our room until bedtime.

Reviews.Title: “We keep returning, but...”
Reviews.Author: Vivi-from-Oslo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at Wildner 6-7 times over the years, and we keep returning when going to Venice, because of the amazing lagoon view, the convenient location and the reasonable room rate. Our last stay was 3 nights in July, but this time we felt that the (few) weak points we have experienced earlier, were more predominant than before. When entering our room it was unbearably hot and the A/C unit didn't seem to work. We went down to the front desk to ask for another room or a quick repair of the A/C, and was told that the air conditioning system had broken down in the whole building, and would be fixed the next morning. We didn't get much sleep that night... The A/C was repaired the next day, in the afternoon, but we realized that it wasn't effective enough for really hot summer days. If we should return to Venice during the summer months, we would choose another hotel, but it will not be with a light heart. I have read other reviewers describe the front desk staff as very helpful. That's good, but if you don't need help with concert tickets, travel arrangements or sightseeing advice, it would still be nice to be greeted when you arrive at the desk, and to be asked if you had a nice stay when you check out. It seems to be too many people alternating behind the desk. Not a big thing, but it used to be much better, and it could definetely enhance the hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “good room, nice food, nice staff - recommend”
Reviews.Author: JanePuz
Reviews.Content: 3 month later I want to say thank you for this hotel. We arrived 1 day before we plan, at night, and without booking for this night. It was dark and raining. So, it was just the 1st hotel we`ve knoked (opposite to the vaporetto station). and they have room! Strange, but room (and view to ancient castillo) and food and hospitality was really great (especially in compare with hotel "Mercurio" i`ve booked before for other days, as we saw later). Extra plus - perfect and easy destination - you have no reason to spend time in game "find your hotel". We paid value for money 150 euros for 3 persons. Only 1 problem you can face - no elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, Fantastic View, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: FryitzLynn
Reviews.Content: Hotel Wildner is in a perfect location, facing the lagoon and a very short walk from St. Marks. We requested lagoon views (about four months before our visit) and were rewarded with absolutely spectacular vistas from our rooms. The rooms were very nice with excellent bathrooms and very comfortable beds. Though not cheap, the value of this property can not be beat compared with other Venice hotels with similar locations and views. The breakfast was very good, and the staff pleasant and helpful. We will definitely return on any future trip to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “always a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: Nelda51
Reviews.Content: A stay at the Hotel Wildner is always a pleasure for us from beginning to end. The staff is exceptional and will enhance your visit tremendously. Their restaurant, under the enthusiastic direction of Luca Fullin, is buonissimo. A fine meal with fantastic local wines awaits you with a view like none other.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but thats about it....”
Reviews.Author: rgally
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Venice in May and were less than impressed with Hotel WIldner. The location was the only highlight of this hotel. It is a short walk from the San Zacharia (spelling?) water bus stop. It is right on the water which would make for a great view IF you are lucky enough to have a room facing the water. Our room was located on the 5th floor and with no lift, we definitely logged a few extra exercise miles going up and down the stairs multiple times a day. When we arrived to our room, it was reminiscent of a cruise ship, very close quarters, complete with wood paneling. Definitely didn't resemble the pictures we had viewed on the website or TA. Needless to say, we had a negative first impression but knowing we had 3 nights to endure, we wanted to make the best of it. Things took a turn for the worse when we were able to hear a fellow neighbor snoring at night. The walls were paper thin. The staff was also less than helpful or welcoming. This was the only hotel in all of Italy that we received such lackluster service from the Front Desk Staff. All things considered, I would definitely recommend looking elsewhere before booking this hotel. There are much better options for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Location..Location...Location...!!!”
Reviews.Author: divegal8
Reviews.Content: This was a glorious hotel with a killer view. The service was awesome and the room was quite apacious for a triple. The view from our room on the 4th floor was to die for!!! Grat AM breakfast. One lady next to us said that they had the best croissants she ever ate. I believe it!! THe only drawback was that there was no elevator. It was a a bit of a haul up to the 4th floor. Elvio was super and can't do enough to help. Made tour arrangements and even had a water taxi on hand for us at 4am!!! I would go here again and again and again. Cannot recommend it enough!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wildner; the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: aart1961
Reviews.Content: Wonderful Hotel; booked through internet. Please visit their Facebook page and you'll get free wifi during your stay! We had room 48 on the 5th floor, no lift (as stated on the website) overlooking the roofs of Venice. Location is on the quay of Venice only 2 bridges awaiy from St. Marcs square. Breakfast in the morning and looking to all the tourists walking along; or were they looking at us having breakfast?? Value for money!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Perfect”
Reviews.Author: fazetwo
Reviews.Content: The hotel Wildner is perfectly positioned for a wonderful city break. Close enough to all the sights without the "over inflated price tag" Our room was on the top floor without the lagoon view (48) but had a wonderful view of the roof tops of Venice, delightful. Bathroom, bed linnen and room were spotless and freshly cleaned on a daily basis. You can sit and watch the hustle and bustle of 'daily life in Venice' from the bar/restaurant, great location. Extremely handy for public transpot as the water bus stop is dead oposite the hotel. Would I recomend the hote? YES without a doubt. Excellent value (Venice standards) and location.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fabulous! What a view!”
Reviews.Author: veggiefairy
Reviews.Content: Great location. Doesnt give you a sense of grandeur when you walk into reception and round the corridors-BUT when you arrive in your room-WOW. We were so pleased. 3 picture windows, with a little sofa alcove over looking the lagoon. We couldnt have asked for more. I would reccommend to anyone. Our cleaner was like a ghost- but every time we came back to our room everything was cleaned, fresh towels given and bed made up. So lovely. Also on our last day they allowed us to leave our bags there all day until we were ready to collect and leave the island. My only negatives are that the menu is pricey and the drinks are too. Breakfast was average, but perfectly adequate. Thanks for a great experience. We had a fab time and didnt want to leave. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect February Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: BMG05
Reviews.Content: We can not say enough good things about this hotel. This is the third time we have stayed here and we think it is the best place to stay overall in Venice. There are no elevators, so the rooms are up stairs but are all spotlessly clean with comfortable beds and pillows. If you have a canal view, your view is magnificent. The people at the front desk are so accommodating and nice and you immediately feel so welcomed. There is nothing they will not do for you. The restaurant is fantastic, and there are may Venetians who dine there in the evenings, so reserve so you won't miss this delicious fresh, local "slow" food, one of the best we found in Venice. The wine list is impressive. In the mornings, a copious breakfast is served in the enclosed terrace right on the canal, and you see Venice wake up and all the tourists walking by to St. Marks. It is a treat that must be experienced. We are already making plans to return to the Wildner!

Reviews.Title: “Special family run hotel in wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: RCArtist
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful stay at the Hotel Wildner. Lovely room, amazing views, fabulous slow food and organic wines and, most importantly, kind and friendly staff who make you feel special. A real family hotel. Thank you, Wildner.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, get a room with a view”
Reviews.Author: AndrewDraper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my in-laws - they had a room with a view at the front, we had a room without a view at the back (with a view of the aircon units of the building next door). Both rooms were clean and well decorated but its certainly worth paying the extra money for the view. While we were there the town flooded (as it has a tendancy to do) as did the ground floor of the hotel. The staff were very helpful and brought breakfast up to our room, lent us Wellington boots etc (though my feet were too big, ask early if it happens to you), and brought our luggage down while we were sightseeing. Only downside is that you have to pay for the wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value and location”
Reviews.Author: Ausfamily_10
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Wildner is a 5minute walk from San Marco Square and has a lagoon outlook. Staff (particularly Elvio in reception) are extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Breakfast was good and the view of the lagoon a wonderful bonus.

Reviews.Title: “The same warm and inviting experience over several years of visits.”
Reviews.Author: Pietro359
Reviews.Content: Not only a wonderful location from which to start one's journey thru Venice each morning (the Alilaguna ferry from and returning to the airport, is only 50 meters from the hotel's entrance), the Wildner has been a personal favorite of mine for several years now in its service, charm, excellent ristorante and in its ability as an establishment to remain always the same, making one feel as though they are returning to a home abroad. The Wildner possesses a beautiful & rewarding character in ensuring one an enjoyment of old world Venice in the way it remains unpretentious yet solidly handsome and attractive, rare qualities for any modern, much-traveled city to maintain yet the Wildner exhibits this depth of quality by remaining true to the city and mirroring its elegance with a knowing heart and sincerity. The front desk and its level of service for arranging for anything during one's visit, is ever warm and engaging - smiles come easy and one is never felt to be hurried or not otherwise welcome to be there with them in this humble lodging. Each morning's excellent breakfast can be spent sitting and looking out across the lagoon and at all the passers-by on the busy Riva degli Schiavoni, a perfect perch to watch Venice come to life at daybreak from a vantage point that has an unobstructed view of the morning sunrise whose light fills the ristorante.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Exploring Venice”
Reviews.Author: LivingInTheFog
Reviews.Content: Nice, quiet hotel with an excellent restaurant just minutes from the chaos of Piazza San Marco and right next to the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop. We spent five nights here in mid-September. It was a great location for exploring Venice, whether on foot getting pleasantly lost in the alleys that line the canals to the north and wending our way to Rialto or hopping on a vaporetto to La Guidecca or Murano. We had a standard double on the third floor and were happy to find that it was on the back side of the hotel facing a peaceful courtyard with a view of tiled rooves and the church of San Zaccaria in the distance. Breakfast was delicious and plentiful with a variety of items to choose from. We also enjoyed the exceptional food and service at the restaurant a couple of our nights there (as well as the 10% discount for hotel guests). The staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Elvio at the front desk and the breakfast servers. The only negative for some might be the fact that there is no lift so you'll need to carry your luggage up the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place To Stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: ArnoldB
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in this small, modest hotel. The staff was incredibly helpful, with very good email communication while we were working on reservations. When requesting info on how to get there from the train station, they emailed back quickly giving very precise and helpful advice. It is a one minute walk from the ferry. The room was comfortable and super clean. Our view of the laguna was stunning. Even though it was right on the main drag, the windows were very well insulated and the noise at night was almost non-existent. It had good wireless connection, the restaraunt was decent. You can't beat a hotel with great location, a friendly staff helpful in so many ways, and cleanliness. We would stay there again, without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifico”
Reviews.Author: Nelda51
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Wildner is one of our favorite hotels in Italy. The management and staff are exceedingly helpful and friendly. Breakfast is something to wake up to. The restaurant is exceptional - a true gem. Try the razor clams!

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST”
Reviews.Author: FIREGD
Reviews.Content: best hotel best location best room these with the view best receptionist ,elvio. best breakfast venice the best ----------------------------------------------------- g.d from greece

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: lorraine68
Reviews.Content: we stayed in a quadruple room for two nights overlooking the basin(name of waterfront at st marks) in Venice what a fab location the views at the front of the hotel were beautiful we watched the sun come up in the morning and the cruise liners being pulled into Venice. The hotel was really lovely, spotlessly clean, all staff were polite & helpful, on arrival they gave us a map of Venice circled where we were and then had the porter carry our bags up to our room (no lift). The room was spacious considering we had a double and two singles. We didn't eat in the hotel as it was quite expensive, if you just wander around and get lost you find some great restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, great location, super value”
Reviews.Author: SecretSpi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is small and friendly and situated right on the quayside nor far from St Mark's square. The atmosphere and deco has enough old world charm but the hotel is clean and well-kept. The breakfast was superb. I have no criticisms to make - as others have pointed out, there is no lift but with a room on the 2nd floor this was no problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with a splendid view of the Grand Canal and at a vaporetto stop; clean, but not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: elleng
Reviews.Content: It's hard to know where to stay in Venice--or Rome for that matter--so I just picked the Hotel Wildner because it was right on the Grand Canal and in front of the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop (we arrived very late by plane and didn't want to have to navigate Venice's intricate streets late at night), far enough from the crowds of Piazza San Marco, but close enough to walk there. It proved to be a great strategy, although I wouldn't say that the Hotel Wildner was necessarily one of the best hotels to stay at in Venice. First the positives: 1) Our room did not overlook the Grand Canal. but the breakfast area did, so that in and of itself was worth the stay, since we looked out on the Maria della Salute and Maria Maggiore churches every morning. 2) The staff was incredibly thoughtful. We told them we were leaving the next morning at 6:15, and they had a cup of coffee and breakfast ready to go for us, even though breakfast service didn't begin until 7:00. 3) There was plenty to choose from at breakfast, and the fruit was cut by someone at the restaurant rather than bought pre-cut and packed in a jar or plastic container The potential down sides: 1) Our room was three flights up. Not a deal breaker, but the stairway is very narrow, which made it awkward. 2). Our room was not minuscule, but there wasn't a lot of extra room either. 3) While the room was in very good condition and not shabby in the least, it seemed a little claustrophobic. Everything seemed like it was high quality, but the decor just didn't do it for me. I'm not sure that a view is necessary when visiting Venice, since you're on the canal quite a bit anyway, but I enjoyed the view of the canal anyway. The next time I wouldn't hesitate to stay somewhere that is not on any canal--grand or small--such as the Hotel Giorgione, which is on a very quiet side street in a non-touristy neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: dc222
Reviews.Content: A great value in Venice. One of the least expensive options we found, but was perfect. Rooms have older furniture, but are clean and comfortable. We had a lagoon view and it was fantastic. Located steps from San Marco, you couldn't ask for a better location. Water shuttle to the airport leaves from basically outside the hotel, which was very convenient. Not the most luxurious hotel, but we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pensione, Great View”
Reviews.Author: macgarret
Reviews.Content: Historic boarding house overlooking Venice lagoon, "Old World" style and atmosphere to rooms and decor: don't worry... all mod-cons (except no elevator/lift). Stunning views from front upper story windows, great morning atmosphere on Riva degli Schiavoni. The excellent restaurant with lagoon views on the ground floor, provides a perfect venue for breakfast. Our room was clean, spacious, well furnished and equipped with very effective air conditioning. Hotel very well located for the Vaporetto and all the main tourist attractions. The desk and restaurant staff friendly and helpful. Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable stay at an amazing hotel - perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Chester0319
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here over the Easter holiday with my partner and we were just amazed with this hotel. Firstly, great staff from the front desk to the restaurant. All very professional, efficient and friendly. Second - our huge room with modern bathroom and of course the spectacular views of the lagoon. It is breathtaking! Third - the restaurant. It is very difficult where to start with the food. Had really great fresh scallops as a starter. Definitely the best meal we had on our trip. The resto has a nice view of the lagoon and was busy but not noisy at all. A very nice atmosphere. Extensive wine list and the restaurant manager Luca had the best recommendations. Fourth - the location, close to Plaza San marco, right in front of San Zaccaria boat station. It is in the middle of 5 star hotels and is definitely great value for money for where it is. So all in all highly recommended! If the hotel is busy on the dates you are travelling make sure to try the restaurant - reservations recommended :)

Reviews.Title: “Good beyond the taste...”
Reviews.Author: cdichio
Reviews.Content: Fabuolous hotel perfectly located to offer one of the most amazing views of this gorgeous city. It is just priceless to wake up in the morning and admire the lagoon from your windows... and the funny thing is that you really feel at home! Staff is very frinedly and helped organising our visits with great suggestions. We tried the restaurant and we did not want to go anywhere else for the entire holiday... not only because the manager is hot, but also because the food and wine list are just as delightful :-) A great stay is guaranteed... good beyond the taste!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place in a beautiful city!”
Reviews.Author: EvaDenHaag
Reviews.Content: Very friendly people who make you feel comfortable. A beautiful spot in a beautiful city.

Reviews.Title: “Charming”
Reviews.Author: jonkicha
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night before going on a cruise and the stay was excellent. All the positive reviews were right on target. Beautiful view - if can splurge it - get a room with a view. There is no elevator - if that's an issue, make sure you ask for a lower level room. Staff was great and very friendly. Breakfast was good for the adults - my kids didn't care for it. The location was great as we only have to take the vaporetto from the Piazale Roma - the bus terminal- directly to the stop near the hotel. We didn't have to drag our suitcases all over the place. If you are taking the vaporetto to the cruise terminal, take the vaporetto to the bus station -piazale roma- and then take the ships' shuttle. There is no direct access to the ship from the vaporetto. Nobody seemed to know that and it took us awhile to get to the ship.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: kms4774
Reviews.Content: We were there during peak season. so our first priority was making sure that we wouldn't spend too much time lugging bags on the crowded streets. We arrived at the train station and took vaporetto 41 (the less scenic, but less crowded, route) to the stop right in front of the hotel. Mission accomplished. We knew the hotel didn't have a lift, but the staff was very helpful in getting bags to our lagoon-view room, which was worth the extra 40E for our one-night stay. The view was spectacular. We also enjoyed the atmosphere in the outdoor dining area for dinner and breakfast. The breakfast, in particular, was well above average. After breakfast was strolled down the street to Doge's Palace and St. Mark's. Getting from the hotel to our cruise ship was a bit more complicated, since the Allaguna stop to the port was in the process of being relocated. Overall, a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, views & dinning.”
Reviews.Author: Eatherbunny
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 45, ocean view. The sights & sounds from this room's window made our trip to Venice perfect. There are no lifts in this hotel and the staircase is narrow. An express boat transports you straight from the airport to the front door at San Zaccaria, 200m up from San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “5 reasons to stay in Pensione Wildner”
Reviews.Author: kseshe
Reviews.Content: 1) It is easy reachable form the Airport. Alilaguna stops just in front of it and there is no need to travel with your heavy suitecases up an down the bridges 2) Everything is easy reachable from Pensione Wildner - a really great location. When getting up a bit earlier one can even have a lucky chance to see St.Marco square without any soul on it during the high season. This view is really fantastic. :) 3) Great views form the rooms, notwithsanding what exactly your are overlooking: the laguna or the St.Zaccharia Church. I preferred the last option and observed the laguna every day during the breakfast. 4) The breakfast is the forth reason for choosing Pensione Wildner. The buffet is to be charactarized as hearty as to be compared with the other ones I've had in Italy. And you would have a delightful view from the restaurant's windows, when having your meal. 5) The stuff is wery nice and helpful. Although there is no lift in the hotel (however I would rather mention the fact among the advances, since climbing the stairs is good for one's heart), they would help you to carry you suitecases up.

Reviews.Title: “great views from front room”
Reviews.Author: eagle19
Reviews.Content: Hotel Wildner has the best views across to San Giorgio Maggiore and down to the prommenarde. The room was OK and there is no elevator but the view is worth it. The hotel is close to transport and St Marco Square.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!”
Reviews.Author: AF4
Reviews.Content: Perfect location with views over the Grand Canal. Walking distance to everything. Restaurant was excellent with friendly waiters. Rooms were clean and what you would expect for the standard of hotel. Reception staff very helpful with concert bookings and luggage holding.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Cozy Venetian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WandaLust88
Reviews.Content: Small, clean, nicely appointed hotel with friendly front office people, especially Elvio. Ample continental-type breakfast included with room tariff. Great location - just a few "blocks" from St. Mark's Plaza, water taxis/buses located in front of hotel. All rooms have nice views. We enjoyed our stay and would definitely recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: allayden
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed Pensione Wildner. It was in a perfect location. The room was very comfortable. The breakfast the next morning was more than you could possible eat. The staff was friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel well positioned to reach all the main sights on foot”
Reviews.Author: astroman042000
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms were on the small side, but comfortable and clean, and it's well worth paying the extra for a lagoon view. There's no lift, so bear that in mind. We spent 5 nights and sampled the hotel restaurant twice - excellent both in quality and wine selection. Hotel is only a couple of hundred meters walk from St Mark's Square and within easy reach of the surrounding shopping areas. Venice was never going to be cheap, but we were not at all dissappointed with this hotel & would recomend it to anyone on a short break to the city. Price wise it is comparable to others in a similar location. Staff were very helpful & spoke good English.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LMIBolton
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Wildner for five nights from 28th May to 2nd June, 2009. The view from our room across the lagoon towards San Giorgio Maggiore was absolutely wonderful and, as the hotel is situated less than 100m. from the San Zaccaria vaporetto stop with no bridges to walk over, its convenience for travel is unsurpassed. In addition to this, it is less than five minutes walk to Piazza San Marco. What more could one ask of a hotel location in Venice? The service we received was brilliant. As with most Venice hotels, the Wildner has no lift and our room was on the third floor; help with our luggage was offered without being requested on both our arrival and departure. All the staff were attentive, friendly and helpful. On two occasions, we ate in the reataurant where we had high quality food served in an excellent manner. The breakfast of cereals, cold meats, cheese, fruit and yoghurt with bread rolls and sweet pastries and coffee was also very good. Having read on Trip Advisor that rooms in Venice tend to be small, we were pleasantly surprised by the size of our room. We were also very impressed by the cleanliness of the hotel. We have nothing but praise for the Wildner, but we would like to suggest that it does not sell itself as well as it might; for example, we wanted to tell our friends about our great experince, but had to ask for leaflets about the hotel. We think it would be a good idea to put these, as well as the restaurant menu, in the welcome pack in the rooms. This, however, is a minor criticism of a superb hotel which we would recommend very highly to anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and views”
Reviews.Author: curmudgeon99
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Hotel Wildner twice, in April 2007 and October 2005. We liked the hotel, and would happily return. Many hotels in Venice are a challenge to find, but Wildner is located by both a Vaporetto stop and the Alilaguna airport boat. There is a lot of activity out front during the day, but it quiets down at night. The rooms were reasonably spacious and maintained. I enjoyed breakfasts watching the crowds go by. The view rooms have a wonderful view across St Marks basin and the bustling waterfront. It's not a high-end hotel, but good value for the money for the tourist. The biggest limitation is the lack of an elevator; if you are on the upper floors, the stairs get a bit old. A slight drawback is that the Alilaguna boats sound their horns when backing out from the dock - might bother a light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Venice”
Reviews.Author: Yuko2009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Wildner from 18 to 21 May 2009 in triple room overlooking the lagoon. We booked a triple room through Venere, but it was a standard triple room without lagoon view. We contacted the hotel for upgrading to the room with view. When reached the hotel ( just 2 min walk from water bus station ), we found that our room situated at 3rd floor ( no lift ) and very small for 3 people. When I requested for the change of the room to the reception, he did it immediately and we got the bigger room with beautiful lagoon view. The breakfast is at the ground floor restaurant. The view is so nice and the place is airy, the breakfast is sufficient. We wanted to sit there whole the day to see people pass by, beautiful lagoon. Last time I stayed at hotel Lux. Both of them charged almost the same amount, but Wildner is definitely better! We will come back to this hotel for sure. One more thing to add. We gave our clothes for laundry ( 9 pieces altogether ). If you give your clothes before 9 am, they are back at around 3-4pm in a same day. Total amount they charged was 40 euro, which is very reasonable, considering all washed, pressed and came on hangers with polythene cover.

Reviews.Title: “Nice view and location”
Reviews.Author: PuneetDhar
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through Venere.com Nice breakfast. Very helpful staff. Lovely location close to San Marco and with a lovely view of the church and bell tower (San Giorgio Maggiore) across the waters. Good access to the public boat (vaporetto) routes. mild old world charm. Expensive but worthwhile just for the excellent location! I stayed here with my old parents, and they enjoyed the proximity to St Marks piazza and the Doge's palace especially at night when this assumes a magical quality especially in summer months - full of restaurants symphonic playing music in tandem, painters and souvenir sellers, masked and painted entertainers etc. On one morning, my mother wasnt feeling well, so the staff cheerfully sent up a good sample from the buffet! Small hotel, no lift - but worth the climb for good canal views! Stayed last night in Venice in a fully modern hotel near the station at a third of the price!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT LOCATION, great view”
Reviews.Author: ItalyKent
Reviews.Content: Perfect location right across San Zaccaria vaporetto stops and easy walking distance from San Marco square. Our room was quiet at night, clean and spacious with 3 windows with a fantastic view over San Giorgio island. Breakfasts was good and quite generous and the restaurant was always very popular in the evening, with excellent seafood, and lovely view over the island. The staff were pleasant. I'd recommend the Hotel Wildner to anyone who wants a practical location and view at a reasonable price (for Venice), But be aware that there is no lift!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Nelda51
Reviews.Content: "Your wish is at our command". My husband and I had a wonderful time at the Wildner Hotel. The staff, especially Elvio, were gracious and most helpful; very accommodating. Our breakfasts were plentiful and the restaurant is first rate with excellent seafood.

Reviews.Title: “A great location!”
Reviews.Author: Gondolia
Reviews.Content: Located but a 30-second walk from the Vaporetto stop at San Zaccaria, we couldn't have chosen a more central and convenient place to stay in Venice. We were travelling with an 11 year old who just loved (as we did) being able to travel around Venice by water, from our own doorstep. And we were only a few hundred yards from St Marks and the Doges Palace. We booked a bedroom for three, which worked very well despite the relatively small size of the bedroom. We had a view over the roof-tops at the back of the hotel, which were surprisingly attractive. The fact that we were fit, active and out all day meant that we were happy on the top (fourth) floor - not to be recommended if you are less physically able or if you want to 'pop back' to your room several times during the day as there is no lift! The rooms on the 1st or 2nd floors would be a better bet, and so would a view of the lagoon, but we were on a more modest budget! Breakfast was the only meal we ate at the hotel, as we were only in Venice for three days and there were too many other places we wanted to try. But the evening meal at the restaurant looked really appetising, and our breakfasts were very adequate, with good service. The view from the ground floor restaurant is spectacular - you are almost IN the Lagoon - with fascinating street-life on the walkway outside. The staff were particularly welcoming when we sat in the restaurant with a late night Amaretto while our youngster got off to sleep upstairs. This is a very simple but friendly and efficient pensione. We were made to feel very welcome, and the reception team went out of their way to help us, even sending on to us, with no fuss, possessions left behind in our bedroom. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay very much”
Reviews.Author: LoveEurope2008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I ended our cruise in Venice and one of the reasons we chose the hotel was that the novelist Henry James stayed there and wrote part of a novel there - connecting to literary history. The hotel was on the lagoon, a hundred or so yards from St. Marks - very convenient. The staff was very helpful and pleasant, sent me a map of their location and how to navigate the trip from the cruise terminal to their door which really helped. Their location was perfect; they had a restaurant outside (enclosed) where we ate great breakfasts and watched activities unfold outside. We also ate supper there one night too. We would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: orangemochafrap
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 nights at the Pensione Wildner. We had a triple room that faced the lagoon and it was spacious compared to other triple rooms we had in Italy. Everyone at the hotel was courteous and they were also prompt with e-mail correspondence. They have online reservations as well. The breakfast was the best we had in Italy. It was buffet style cereal, fresh fruit, rolls, cheese, meats, coffee and juice. The restaurant where you eat breakfast faces the lagoon so it has a view as well. Beds were comfortable. The room had air conditioning but at the time we were there it was cold and rainy so it was not needed. We did not eat dinner at the hotel, but it seemed to be very popular. The location is fantastic, only a 5-10 min walk to San Marco Square. Watching all the activity in the lagoon was enjoyable. Best part of the lagoon view was waving goodbye to the cruise ships as they left Venice! Even though it was not on the Grand Canal, it was a great place to stay. If we go back, we will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: clmom
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Wildner is a great little hotel near St. Mark's Square, the Bridge of Sighs and major valparetto (water bus) stops. It has a friendly staff, clean (though typical European small) and wonderful "people watching" restaurant and good breakfast. It is expensive for Americans with the current dollar to euro exchange rate (195 euro for a small double room booked through a hotel website). We probably could have gotten a better rate by contacting the hotel directly but couldn't find the web address and were making our reservations within a couple of weeks of our arrival. We would stay here again based on the great location but having such a nice, welcoming staff is an added bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Venice on view”
Reviews.Author: 2Wayfarers
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful few days stay in Venice .The views were brilliant and each morning to open the shutters on the panorama of boats and people was amazing .There was such a buzz watching all the tourists and variety of boats whilst being so close to all of much loved main attractions of this beautiful city .The room (no. 27) was spacious ,the bed large and comfortable ,the bathroom facilities good. During the night the waterfront was quiet and sprang to life at about 7am with boats bringing the workers into the city...the morning view of St Georgio was spectacular.The restaurant was open most of the day and had a varied menu at reasonable prices (including discount for residents ).The staff were friendly and outgoing and Max and Antonio made mealtimes lively .Reception was efficient and friendly and dealt with any queries readily .Would definitely stay here again ; the location of the hotel being ideal for water bus transport and easy walking distance to St Marks .

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Wildner”
Reviews.Author: WibiLondon
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Hotel Wildner. We agree with other positive reviews. Our room was very clean and spacious with 2 windows offering a fabulous view over the lagoon towards San Giorgio Maggiore. We liked the parquet floor. The bathroom was good-sized, with shower, and again, very clean. Shutters keep out the light if you want, and the windows are pretty soundproof - we had very quiet nights - surprising as you are right across from the San Zaccaria vaporetto and Alilaguna stops (which is very convenient both for arrival and departure and if you want to explore Venice by vaporetto. You can do so on foot as well ( you are very close to St Mark's Square). Breakfast (self-service) offers meat, cheese, warm croissants and pastries, cereals and fruit There is a 10% discount if you eat in the restaurant - we didn't take this up, but plan to do so on future occasions. The staff were all very pleasant and friendly - we arrived in the middle of the night due to a delayed flight, but that was not a problem. We could also leave our luggage on our last day until quite late. We'd recommend the Hotel Wildner to anyone who wants an excellent location and view at a great price (for Venice).

Reviews.Title: “Always a delight to return to the Pensione Wildner”
Reviews.Author: Pietro359
Reviews.Content: Venice is a city of imcomparable beauty and passion that can best be appreciated in its quiet moments, rare that they are. I've found such an experience can be more deeply felt in lodging at simple locandas, albergos and pensiones and of these, I must place the Pensione Wildner there on the beautiful vista of the Riva degli Schiavoni at the top of my picks. I have greatly enjoyed staying there several times and this last visit had the great privilege to have our accommodation be arranged by a gentleman named Elvio who has been with the Hotel only a short time but whose manner and handling were one of the highlights of our stay. His attention to detail, his sincerity and his genuine concern to apply himself to our enjoying our visit as much as possible were a perfect complement to Venice's aura of serenity and charm. A wonderful stay made even better by having someone make us feel so at home.

Reviews.Title: “Wildner was a Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: mmgreen
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice stay at the Wildner Hotel and Ristorante. The price was right , the location was spectacular, and the staff was very nice. One of the waiters at the restaurant was a bit snooty, but the others were very nice, and the food was some of the best in Venice. There are no elevators in this small and quaint hotel, but it added to the quaintness. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: SuzC
Reviews.Content: I spent 6 nights at the Hotel Wildner. The lagoon view room was very clean and spacious with 2 windows overlooking the lagoon and San Giorgio Maggiore. The bathroom was good-sized, too. Shutters keep out the light if you want, and the windows are pretty soundproof. There was some noise from other rooms, but it was not excessive. The breakfast was above average with meat, cheese, warm croissants and pastries, cereal, juice, etc. There is a 10% discount if you eat in the restaurant. The food in the restaurant is above average and reasonably priced for Venice. The location is right across from the San Zaccaria vaporetto and Alilaguna stops, which was very convenient. The staff were very pleasant and friendly and there was usually someone who spoke some English. I had an early morning departure and they offered to make a caffe before I left. Neighboring hotels include the Londra Palace and the Danieli. The $500+ I spent at the Danieli got me a tiny room with single bed and no view. I'd recommend the Hotel Wildner to anyone who wants an excellent location and view at a great price (for Venice).

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: wonderingbear
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel after reading all the other reviews in Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed at all. The hotel was very clean and the breakfast was excellent with plenty of choices (cereal, pastries, fruit, cakes, meats, coffee). We also ate at the hotel in the evening and the standard of food was again excellent, you do need to book a table as it does get very busy in the evening. The location was better than we could have wished for, the hotel is central for all Venice has to offer and the airport ferry is across the street. The staff are very, very helpful. We had our money and credit cards stolen in the market on the first day, the staff at the hotel did everything they could for us which was a comfort when in a foreign country. I would highly recommend this hotel and if we visit Venice again we would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel with an Enchanting View!”
Reviews.Author: marayga
Reviews.Content: You canâ€™t go wrong with the Hotel Wildner with its charm, enchanting view, and reasonable price all in the heart of Venice. Everyone was friendly and helpful. Elisabetta offered restaurant suggestions and the baroque concert she sold us tickets for was wonderful. We had a roomy lagoon view room with twin beds and a couch with table. The bathroom was also roomy and had an incredible shower. The breakfast was enjoyable but if you arrived shortly before they stopped serving they were a bit stingy on replenishing the items. We also ate dinner at the restaurant one evening and found the food to be good as well. The location was perfect, close to St. Marks square and to the vaporetto stops. It was amazing to see the cruise ships and the day tourists going by every morning. Venice is truly two different cities by day and night so if possible plan to stay a few days and treat yourself to the Hotel Wildner.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection with a view!”
Reviews.Author: NYCityTraveler
Reviews.Content: Venice's best kept secret. We spent three nights in room #15 overlooking the lagoon and I don't care what the Danielli offers, it gets no better than this. Check this link for photos- better than anything we took: [--] The Wildner is a small sweet spot right on the water with million dollar views at reasonable prices. The rooms and baths are spacious and newly renovated- much more than you might expect at this price. And it is spotless. There is no lift, but DO NOT let that keep you away. The location is superb, only two dreamy waterfront "blocks" from St. Marks. During the day it is lively and scenic, but at night, the city sleeps and so did we- peacefully. The vaporetto noises we soothing, but not intrusive at all. We were there in pleasant weather, and happy to have the windows open. I am sure in the heat of the summer, with the AC on and windows shut it would be totally silent. Breakfast was an amazing treat- right on the "street side" cafe which is part of the hotel. It was wonderful so sip coffee and enjoy a great array of pastry, yogurt, fruit, cheese and meats while the Venice awakened before our eyes. What a treat to so close to it all, yet "protected." The owners are delightful, and have added their precious dog "Nina" to the staff- a darling "foundling" they adopted. We would not consider staying anywhere else in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “A room with a view”
Reviews.Author: jjedwards
Reviews.Content: This small boutique hotel is within 5 minutes from San Marco Square, looking out at the Grand Canal. Our second floor room had three large windows from which we could watch the multitude of tourists walking the promenade, many looking up to admire the beautifully kept flower boxes under each window. We could catch a vaporetto just 100 meters from the hotel. Well placed for exploring the narrow streets of Venice, getting to restaurants or generally sightseeing. Convenient covered restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value”
Reviews.Author: TJBF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location, very close to Piazza San Marco. Rialto is within walking distance too. It is right on the grand canal and the water taxi stops directly in front of the hotel. The staff are very friendly and helpful, breakfast is quite good and the restaurant is good too. A great place to sit for a coffee, drink or meal while people watching or enjoying the water view. The rooms are basic but very clean and comfortable. Excellent value for money, you can't beat the location. Definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel with Danieli Views”
Reviews.Author: IVernazza
Reviews.Content: I stayed two night at the Hotel Wildner. The hotel is small and a couple of doors down from the five star Danieli but has the same lagoon views as that expensive hotel. The room are basic, and I mean basic. The furniture is old. My room was not as nice as the room posted in photos, but it was clean and the views from the windows are wonderful. I only had one photo of the view but it contained a large ship inbound to Venice ( I watched several come into port that morning). I never ate at the hotel, and there is a restaurant directly in front of the hotel. The hotel is on the lagoon and just around the corner from St. Marks, the Doge's palace and Bridge of sighs. There are vaparetto stations and other boats right out in front for easy access to other areas. If you need frills, do not stay here, but, if you want a safe and clean place with some of the best views in Venice, then give them a try. The staff was very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, Great location, A little low on quality”
Reviews.Author: LikeMikeWeir
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Wildner for 2 nights from Fri, Sept 30th, 2005 onwards. The weather for the first weekend of October was really pleasant. We had wonderful sunshine and warm temperatures. We flew in from London - into Treviso airport. Contrary to what most people say, the bus ride from Treviso, through Mestre, to Piazzale Roma isn't that painful. The bus is fairly comfortable and the 45min ride goes by fairly quickly as you anticipate your arrival in Venice. There are 2-3 buses that leave right after the flights arrive at the airport. The location is superb. Could not ask for more in this respect. It is situated in the middle of two public boat stops. We took a private taxi from Piazzale Roma and I would recommend it to anybody. Its quite an experience. The Wildner wasn't our first choice. Unfortunately, there was a huge medical convention being held in Venice on the same weekend and there wasn't a room available on the entire island. We were lucky to have gotten a room at the Wildner. The first night we were in Room 41 - smaller and not facing the lagoon. We paid 180 euro for this room. The next day Elisabetta (Manager, very helpful and friendly) agreed to move us to a Lagoon-facing room with 3 large windows. This room cost us 220 euro. The Wildner has a slightly tired look about it - inside and out. Although it is very clean, it gives the impression of being old and out-dated. It is a 3* hotel at best. We climbed up to the 4th floor (yes, thats 8 flights of stairs). There is no elevator and they have strategically placed a poor, old man at the front desk so that you are on your own in terms of carrrying your own luggage. The room we had for the first night was very small and very gloomy. The room is adorned in typical kitschy decor. The washroom, albeit clean, was fairly small. When the hotel says its a double bed, don't bet on it. Ask them. Our room had two single beds put together to form a double bed. It was rather uncomfortable. The A/C barely worked. But to be fair it wasn't needed. The room for the 2nd night was much better. It was very, very large for venice standards. We had 3 large windows opening up to a lagoon view. The view truly is wonderful. You can hear the gondolas sloshing in the water and tourists streaming by on the walkway below. However, at night if you close your shutters, you can't hear a peep. The room had a sitting area on one end and a large cupboard next to the bed. There is wooden flooring through out. The washroom is also larger here. The bed, however, was still quite uncomfortable. The breakfast is included in the price of the room. The breakfast room is rather pleasant. The food is not. There is ust some cereal, milk, juice, yoghurt, cheese and fruit (read apples only). We would have like something warm, not even eggs were available. I'm not quite certain why some people have left really positive reviews for this hotel. There is no touch of quality or luxury visible here. We saw 2 different room configurations. One was their top-floor suite. I would expect a lot more for this price. But alas this is Venice. I would recommend that you do shop around. There are many more better deals to be had at this price. Remember, if you would like a lagoon view for a fraction of what the Danielli would charge you then the Wildner is a pretty good deal. Although there are other hotels on this strip that would provide you with a little more quality. The one redeeming feature, however, was the service of one or two individuals. The 2 gentleman at the front desk were very helpful indeed. On our last day, we were late for our flight, one of them rushed into the kitchen and packed us some light sandwiches and drinks for the trip. Free of charge. Would we stay here again? Not really, and not because we had a terrible experience. All in all, we had a wonderful trip. And we didn't spend too much time in the rooms anyway. But there IS a lot of choice on the island. Spend some time to look around.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Venice Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Calgarymember
Reviews.Content: Early in September, my wife and I stayed 5 nights in a lagoon view room at the Hotel Wildner. Our room was very clean, well air-conditioned, had a room safe and what a terrific view (see photos taken from room windows). The Wildner's location could not be better. We walked everywhere in Venice and ended every night at St Mark's Square basking in the music of the duelling quartets. At night's end, we had a very pleasant, short walk back to the Wildner. There was never a dull moment on San Marco Basin in front of the Wildner but yet the windows were very sound-proof when shut. Every day began with a leisurely breakfast on the covered patio fronting onto the promenade and the Basin. The patio has glass enclosures that can be moved into place in case of inclement weather (not required during our stay). The staff were all helpful and very friendly. We previously visited Venice in 2003, staying in an excellent hotel, but would consider staying only at the Wildner on our next visit. The lagoon view room is definitely worth the premium.

Reviews.Title: “Not sure what all the fuss is about”
Reviews.Author: SThearia
Reviews.Content: We booked (triple room 180 EUR per night) for four nights but checked out after only one, and really can't see why others rave about this hotel. Come on people! Surely it has seen better days and needs a makeover so that it doesn't look so shabby. Yes, it's a pensione, but that's no excuse for the generally poor standard of decoration (inside and out - not exactly inspiring when you see that your hotel is the only building on the water's edge that has a cladding of old grey plaster and nothing else). Our room had dust on the some furniture, unrepaired water damage (marks etc) in the bathroom and a door that had a gap between it and the door frame. Have to admit that the view is pretty nice, but for exactly what percentage of your time are you going to just stand at your hotel window and look out? We quickly found a recently refurbished two bedroom apartment about 1 minute's walk from the same water's edge, at 10 EUR per night less. In case you're wondering, we aren't new to Italy in terms of a holiday destination so this review is a measured one as far as we're concerned. A parallel can be drawn between this hotel and Venice itself - despite the tourist income, there wasn't any evidence of it being reinvested for the benefit of tourists. Got to 'do' Venice once in your life, I guess, but we can't see ourselves going back.
